RemPPDescriptor Struct Reference
[Player Proxy Types]

The RemPPDescriptor struct describes miscellaneous characteristics of a player proxy (PP) respectively the media player it connects. More...


Data Fields

gchar * player_name
 Name of the media player.
gchar * charset
 The character set that is used for text data passed from the PP to RemLib.
guint max_rating_value
 Maximum rating value used by the media player (0 means the player/PP does not support rating).
gboolean supports_seek
 The player/PP supports seeking to a certain position in a plob.
gboolean supports_playlist
 The player has a playlist and the PP can pass the content to RemLib.
gboolean supports_playlist_jump
 The player/PP supports jumping to a certain position in the playlist.
gboolean supports_queue
 The player has a queue and the PP can pass the content to RemLib.
gboolean supports_queue_jump
 The player/PP supports jumping to a certain position in the queue.
gboolean supports_tags
 The player/PP supports tags (for instance like in XMMS2 where songs can be tagged with free choosen words).
RemRepeatMode supported_repeat_modes
 The bitwise or'ed supported repeat modes.
RemShuffleMode supported_shuffle_modes
 The bitwise or'ed supported shuffle modes.

Detailed Description

The RemPPDescriptor struct describes miscellaneous characteristics of a player proxy (PP) respectively the media player it connects.

Field Documentation

gchar* RemPPDescriptor::player_name

Name of the media player.

gchar* RemPPDescriptor::charset

The character set that is used for text data passed from the PP to RemLib.

If unset, RemLib assumes it is UTF-8.

guint RemPPDescriptor::max_rating_value

Maximum rating value used by the media player (0 means the player/PP does not support rating).

gboolean RemPPDescriptor::supports_seek

The player/PP supports seeking to a certain position in a plob.

gboolean RemPPDescriptor::supports_playlist

The player has a playlist and the PP can pass the content to RemLib.

gboolean RemPPDescriptor::supports_playlist_jump

The player/PP supports jumping to a certain position in the playlist.

gboolean RemPPDescriptor::supports_queue

The player has a queue and the PP can pass the content to RemLib.

gboolean RemPPDescriptor::supports_queue_jump

The player/PP supports jumping to a certain position in the queue.

gboolean RemPPDescriptor::supports_tags

The player/PP supports tags (for instance like in XMMS2 where songs can be tagged with free choosen words).

This only makes sense if the player/PP also supports edidting of plobs, i.e. the callback function RemPPCallbacks::update_plob is set.

RemRepeatMode RemPPDescriptor::supported_repeat_modes

The bitwise or'ed supported repeat modes.

RemShuffleMode RemPPDescriptor::supported_shuffle_modes

The bitwise or'ed supported shuffle modes.
